intro: Knautia arvensis var. vulgaris, commonly known as field knautia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It features showy, pink to purple flower heads that resemble daisies, composed of numerous small, pinkish-white ray florets surrounding a central cluster of yellow disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, branching stems and heart-shaped, toothed leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
